shot.desc: The very first weapon in Shellshock Live's list. This weapon's low damage and small explosion radius make it a poor choice for offense; it is generally used to capture crates instead.

big_shot.desc: A minor upgrade from Shot. Deals 10 more damage and has a slightly larger explosion radius.

heavy_shot.desc: A minor upgrade from Big Shot. Deals 10 more damage and has a slightly larger explosion radius than Big Shot.

massive_shot.desc: Another incremental upgrade over its predecessors, dealing 10 more damage that Heavy Shot (for a total of 40) and featuring the greatest explosion radius among them.

three_ball.desc: Shoots 3 projectiles in a horizontal spread. Damage for this weapon is distance based.

five_ball.desc: Shoots 5 projectiles in a horizontal spread.

eleven_ball.desc: Shoots 11 projectiles in a large spread.

twentyfive_ball.desc: The sheer amount of projectiles makes it quite easy to hit shots with this weapon, making it highly useful for hitting something such as crates or targets. When used correctly at long ranges, it can still prove to be deadly.

one_bounce.desc: Bounces once where it lands, and explodes on next impact with the ground. It should be noted that this weapon bounces much more than flares and can bounce over the target.

three_bounce.desc: Behaves much like one-bounce, but instead bounces three times before exploding. Also has increased damage.

five_bounce.desc: Behaves much like one-bounce, but bounces five times before exploding. Damage is doubled to 60.

seven_bounce.desc: Bounces a total of seven times before exploding, making it fairly unpredictable unless shot into a hole.

digger.desc: Digger demonstrates, in a more literal sense, what the aim of the game is: to bury your opponents six feet under. Five devastating blasts into the ground just might bury your opponent - and their chances of defeating you - into middle earth. Digger hits the exact place you hit with every following bounce, meaning a perfect hit deals full damage. However during the bounce, which is rather high as well, the digger can be influenced by wind, x2 Buff, bumpers, portals and even targets. Portals rarely change anything since the weapon goes right back through the portal again. However if the high point of the bounce is within the portal, then the digger will not return to the original spot and instead starts to dig under the exit portal. It is also possible that you don't do full damage. This is because the damage radius is larger than the terrain reduction radius, allowing tanks to stick to the sides of the created hole and not take additional damage.

mega_digger.desc: Take the awesome power of Digger, make the weapon even bigger, and pull the trigger. Or, activate the cannon on your tank. Either way, pending your success in landing Mega-Digger the right way, you'll have four blasts of fury into the ground doing your dirty work on the opposition.

excavation.desc: Perhaps one of the most feared weapons in all of ShellShock Live, Excavation puts the exclamation point on any encounter with the enemy you embrace. Twelve projectiles lay the foundation for the grave site of anyone it comes near, blasting the ground four times for an awesome total of forty-eight times. Get ready to strike terror in the hearts of the baddies! Unlike the previous incarnations Excavation projectiles don't land at the same place after every bounce. To maximize damage use a 45 degree angle if possible when firing, since this drastically reduces the weapons projectile spray and thereby increases damage.

grenade.desc: Imagine a weapon that bounces slightly less than a normal one would, that has the ability to stress players out tremendously pending where it impacts. Grenade does just that. It will bounce four times, losing inertia with each one, then explode furiously at fifth contact with the ground. If you're near it, you might not be playing much longer. Best used when an enemy is down in a pit.

tri_nade.desc: Tri-Nade takes something simple, then makes it complex. Matter of fact, it defies all logic. That's what makes it great! Tri-Nade bounces and acts just like Grenade, but then upon explosion, releases three smaller projectiles that deal 25HP damage a piece (including the original explosion.) This all culminates in a real bad time for the opposition.

multi_nade.desc: If you thought Tri-Nade was a work of art, feast your eyes on Multi-Nade. Two more projectiles fly out of this bad boy, dealing 20HP damage a piece. What more is there to say?

grenade_storm.desc: Grenade Storm is an air-strike weapon that is probably more on the "weird" side than it is the "unique" side. Fifteen projectiles fall from the sky, with fourteen dealing 8HP damage a piece, while the giant grenade you aren't expecting at first deals 50HP damage.

stream.desc: You would be hard-pressed not to equate this weapon to a normal human bodily function, but the jokes stop there. Stream can deal serious damage with the right touch, with twenty projectiles dealing 4 damage a piece. Stream, Creek and River should ideally be fired at an angle of 45 degrees, when firing from a flat surface with no obstacles in the way, because this drastically minimizes the spread leading to much more damage.

creek.desc: "Creek" is basically a body of running water leading into a larger body of water. It's also the sound the door of winning opportunity makes for you when you shoot it accurately. Twenty projectiles dealing 6 damage a piece sure will drench the fiery burning sensation your opponents will feel when their tank explodes.

river.desc: River cannot exactly be explained as a "weak" weapon. Matter of fact, it just plain isn't one. River can do it all: Spread wide enough to cover large areas, do a great deal of damage to one or more tanks, and remain easily accessible as a weapon you'll unlock rather quickly. Twenty large projectiles scatter about to deal 8 damage a piece for a monstrous impact. Given its high spread, it's best to fire this weapon at 50-55 degrees, otherwise the weapon will not concentrate much firepower. It is to note that this weapon will never achieve its full damage under most, if not all circumstances.

tsunami.desc: Oh, what's that? River isn't enough water? Twenty projectiles isn't enough? Well, while Tsunami does not deal as much damage as River, it does provide a nearly-direct stream that slowly moves up like a tidal wave. Fourty-eight projectiles dealing 3HP damage a piece may make you evacuate the game itself in pure terror.

flame.desc: You probably shouldn't play with matches. Unless your "match" is a game in ShellShock Live, where you can use a match in your match to match your opponent in your match. This description probably isn't very helpful thus far, so it'll just be left at this: Flame fires twelve projectiles with a large spread that burn your victim trice at 1HP damage a piece. It may not be very effective, but it could save your rear-end from getting burned in a bet!

blaze.desc: Just like Flame, Blaze burns twice, and that isn't very nice. Fifteen projectiles dealing 4HP damage a piece adds up quick, so be sure to wear your oven mitts when handling this one.

inferno.desc: Inferno is nothing to disco about. Fifteen projectiles dealing 6HP damage a piece completely destroys whatever it lands on. It's possible one could find the weapon boring, but it's also possible you die on the receiving end. Never underestimate Inferno.

roller.desc: Sometimes, weapons are made so accuracy is not a top priority. Roller fills that spot with simplicity. Upon landing, it will continue to roll in the direction it approached the ground from and deal 20 damage upon making contact with a tank.

heavy_roller.desc: What's better than a weapon you only have to aim moderately accurately with a likely chance of hitting? A weapon you only have to aim moderately accurately with a likely chance of hitting that does double the damage!  Although it does double the damage, be careful because it doesn't travel as far on the ground.

groller.desc: Much like it's predecessors, Groller rolls across the ground, but as it rolls it grows larger and larger, building up damage. When it reaches the final form, it will deal 48 damage.

heavy_back_roller.desc: Overshooting your target may not always be a bad thing. Heavy Back-Roller will make room for your overestimation's . The upgraded tier has double the damage and bigger the blast radius for more effectiveness, giving you more reason to use this weapon if you don't know where to aim.

back_groller.desc: Back-Groller is quite a paradox. It rolls backwards, but grows. The bigger it is, the more damage it does. Figuratively it moves forward in maturity, but still rolls backwards. So, is it progressive or regressive? You'll figure it out. This tier is a more risky weapon than the previous tier since it can go either better or worse depending on how long it was rolling, it deals 5 damage at its smallest and 48 at its biggest. Use this more wisely than the first and second tier.

splitter.desc: Sometimes, you just need to own two people at once. Or, maybe you need to grab an air crate and multiplier at once. Or, maybe you need to confuse everyone with portals by firing into both of them simultaneously. Whatever your position is, Splitter has you covered with two powerful 20 damage shots.

double_splitter.desc: Double up on some wide-range goodness with Double-Splitter. Four projectiles each doing up to 18 damage will surely make you a serious contender for MVP.

super_splitter.desc: Imagine Eleven-Ball but with the ability to be more concentrated in one area. That is what Super-Splitter delivers. Each projectile does up to 15 damage, with nine projectiles in total, making it one of the more powerful weapons at your disposal.

splitterchain.desc: Would you believe Splitter can be upgraded into a game-making devastation in its final form? Eight projectiles dealing 18 damage a piece, not affected by distance scaling. Starts off with a single projectile that splits into 2, and those into 4, and then 8. Because these shots are very close together when shot at low power, such shots can bury your target in a hole and can severely decrease their chances of survival. SplitterChain is nothing to be messed with.

breaker.desc: Breaker is simple. You shoot it, it lands, it breaks apart. It doesn't require much skill, but you would be surprised how easy it is to aim incorrectly by actually landing it directly on your target. Be careful!

double_breaker.desc: Double-Breaker is a prime example of how one good thing can turn into many. Four projectiles each dealing 18 damage cover enough area to land any air strike weapon with ease.

super_breaker.desc: While the word "Super-Breaker" sounds like the name of some electrical appliance you would buy at a thrift shop, you probably would not take this weapon so lightly if it was used on you. Nine projectiles each dealing 15 damage make the terrain incredibly bumpy which can either help your next shot or ruin it.

breakerchain.desc: Break away from the chain with eight projectiles dealing each dealing 18 damage. It just keeps going! How do you compete against something that can climb hills, cover 1/4 of the map, and give you and all your teammates something to cry about?

twinkler.desc: Weapons often are calculable. This isn't one of them. You can do a little damage, or you can do a lot. Either way, it twinkles like the tear in your opponent's eye, and is pretty to look at! Each twinkle does 5 damage.

sparkler.desc: A more powerful version of Twinkler, with a larger radius that can affect multiple tanks at once. Sparkling is better than twinkling, right? Each sparkle does 7 damage, and it's enough to wipe the glimmer out of your opponent's eyes.

crackler.desc: Snap, crackle, pop! Crackler will wreak havoc on one or multiple enemies with ease. Each crackle does 9 damage, and there are plenty to go around for everyone.

sniper.desc: Sniper is typically used at long-range as it does more damage the further away the enemy is from the player horizontally. Typically used by higher skilled player as it has a tiny shot radius.

sub_sniper.desc: Although very similar to Sniper, Sub-Sniper allows for the sniper to be shot from both above and below ground, while also increasing the maximum damage to 120 and minimum to 48.

smart_snipe.desc: Unlike the last two tiers, Smart Snipe requires considerably less skill. This weapon fires 10 harmless projectiles which tag the enemy if hit, if one of these projectiles does hits an enemy, another projectile is fired along the same trajectory as the projectile that tagged the enemy. The first 5 projectiles will vary in angles, the second set will vary in power. It will deal 40-100 damage depending on the distance from the player. But be warned, it won't adjust to terrain changes in between the time of the tracker hitting, and the sniper hitting!

cactus.desc: Oh look, a cactus. But when it gets close to the ground, it splits in twelve more of these! Easily damages multiple tanks. If used right, it can do a significant amount damage.

cactus_strike.desc: Unlike Cactus, a flare is shot instead. When it comes to a rest, 4 cacti are dropped from the sky. The main difference is that these cacti split into 6 rather than 12.

bulger.desc: Bulger is one of the default weapons new recruits get to use. Instead of destroying landscape, it will create a small bulge of land around wherever it hits, damaging nearby enemies.

big_bulger.desc: Same as bulger, but does more damage and creates a noticeably bigger hill.

sinkhole.desc: Shoots a shot like normal. Upon landing, several horizontal explosions appear slightly underneath the shot's landing place in a similar fashion as horizon. Explosions happen three times, effectively swallowing up the terrain above and a dent in the ground is formed.

area_strike.desc: Area strike has a much different damaging mechanism as sinkhole. After the shot lands, several random explosions appear at the shot's  landing area, damaging both tanks and terrain.

area_attack.desc: Similar to area strike, but explosions have increased damage and seem to spread out a bit more.

rapidfire.desc: Rapid fire, as the name might suggest, shoots out a large amount of bullets. The projectiles have significant spread and is very inconsistent at longer ranges.

shotgun.desc: Shotgun shoots a large group of bullets all at once, best used at close range to maximize damage.

burst_fire.desc: Burst fire periodically shoots small bursts of bullets. Like its other tiers, bullet spread is very inconsistent.

gatling_gun.desc: One of the most underused and powerful weapons in the game, gatling gun can potentially be one of the first "godweapons" unlocked, provided the player always makes sure to use the previous levels. It rapidly sprays a high damage cone of death at its target with the large amount of projectiles it creates. It also has a use as a "pit weapon" as it can dig enemies into a very steep and deep pit.

tunneler.desc: The most basic Tunneler, it acts as a single shot that can travel through air, then underground before hitting its target. It can be shot underground first, but it will explode upon reaching the surface. Upon switching means of traveling (air>ground) it will reverse its gravity.

torpedoes.desc: Torpedoes shoots a cluster of Tunnelers at the same time. They may be slightly weaker, but they cover a larger area. If used correctly it can be the first weapon in the game to exceed 80 damage other than the Sniper.

tunnel_strike.desc: Tunnel Strike shoots a flare that summons a group of 9 tunnelers from underneath when it comes to a rest. The summoned tunnelers have a bit of spread, making this weapon most effective when used at the bottom of the map.

mega_tunneler.desc: Is Tunneler is not enough for you? What about its upgraded, mega version? This bad boy does twice the damage, with a huge blast radius. Your enemies now have to fear both air and ground.

horizon.desc: The horizon stays true to its name and always creates 5 explosions each to the left and right of the impact point, each dealing 10 damage, in a fashion similar to

sweeper.desc: Sweeper stretches that horizontal axis to infinity. Once it hits the ground it will fire 2 projectiles perfectly on the horizontal axis of where you hit, one to the left and one to the right. These deal 30 damage each and can only deal friendly fire when the shooter or a teammate is stacked on an opponent that is hit, due to it having an AOE explosion when it hits an enemy tank. They pass through all terrain, meaning a hit anywhere on the map that is on the same height as the enemy will hit. However, it can bounce off bumpers and is affected by black holes. It should be noted that the projectiles on both sides only hit once, meaning maximum damage done is 60, unless the projectiles hit tanks that are stacked on top of each other, hence why Sweeper has an AOE explosion. If you land a perfect shot you do no damage because the shot starts to the left and right of the enemy but doesn't touch it, meaning a miss is required.

air_strike.desc: Air Strike is the first flare type weapon unlocked in the game. When fired, it acts similarily to a grenade in the sense that it bounces about, but that is the extent of the similarities. After it stops moving, 3 bombs fall from the sky in close accord, with a decent explosion radius that makes it highly likely for multiple shots to hit. Of the weapons in the family, this is the most all-around weapon, and is generally good in any situation.

helicopter_strike.desc: Helicopter strike is the first upgrade to Air Strike. It is also a flare weapon, and it deals the same amount of damage per hit. However, the bombs dropped are much more numerous and closer together than the Air Strike, and the explosion radius is much smaller than the air strike. This weapon sacrifices damage for the largest horizontal area of effect in the family.

ac_130.desc: The AC-130 function is the same as an Air Strike, however its weapons deal much more damage (the largest in the family) and have a slightly larger explosion radius.

artillery.desc: Artillery drops 3 bombs from the sky, dealing damage and greatly damaging the terrain. To guarantee maximum destruction, the bomb drops are ordered and delayed, with the center bomb dropping first, followed by the leftmost and then the rightmost. This weapon is the most destructive, and can easily force your enemies into the bottom of the map.

flower.desc: The Flower is one of the most powerful and reliable early game weapons in the game, posing a threat even at high levels. It will rapidly create 8 explosions one after another in the form of a circle that makes the total explosion truly look like a flower. These explosions move clockwise or counterclockwise depending on whether you fire to the left or right. Because with every explosion the Flower reduces terrain, if you hit it beneath an enemy it will land multiple hits this way, maximizing damage. Always fire the weapon this way, direct hits are a waste. The way the explosions move are always the most positive way for you.

bouquet.desc: The Bouquet is functionally equal to the Flower. The difference is that it will create a smaller version of the flower and then follow up with a beefed up orange-white version, destroying a much bigger area and painting the picture of a flower surrounded by petals. The first circle does 10 damage per explosion the second one 12 per explosion.

guppies.desc: Sprays numerous fish with varied powers and angles. It's highly inaccurate at long range or low power shots. Damage is distance based.

minnows.desc: Fires larger fish capable of doing more damage.

goldfish.desc: Fires weaker fish, but in higher quantities.

earthquake.desc: Deals 10 damage to all enemies on the map and causes the terrain shift that happens normally every 10 turns. Goes through shields. Good for getting yourself out of a hole, raising your enemies out of cover, or finishing off a critical HP tank with no risk of missing.

mega_quake.desc: Somehow there is an even scarier version of Earthquake. Increasing the damage to 15 per tank is the weapon fiercely named "Mega-Quake".

banana.desc: The Banana will travel until it is close to hitting the ground, at which point it will seperate into peel and fruit. The fruit will get shot at the point a projectile would normally hit at, so while the Banana looks like it is hitting weird, you can fire it like any normal weapon. The interesting part is the peel, which stops and gets knocked back by recoil. If hit directly from above the peel will hit the same place the fruit hit for a distance of about half the map, so firing the banana in this way maximizes damage. The damage is seperated into 45 for the fruit and 15 for the peel.

banana_split.desc: Twice the bananas, twice the fun. The Banana Split is similar to the Banana with the exception that the 2 fruits now only each deal 25 damage and the 2 peels 10 each, increasing the maximum damage potential to 70.

banana_bunch.desc: Similar to banana split, shooting 5 bananas at 15 damage each. Can be fairly powerful if shot at a high angle.

snake.desc: Snake shoots a shot that resembles a snake head. When it lands, the snake will start "slithering" randomly on the map, exploding every so often when it does so. On a lucky shot, the snake can go straight down, continuously dealing damage to the victim.

python.desc: The same as snake, except it is larger in size and slithers longer on the screen. Python (probably) has a  bigger tendency to go straight down, making it fairly effective on a direct hit.

cobra.desc: The biggest of them all, although pythons are bigger in real life. Cobra is the largest in size when compared to the other upgrades and slithers the longest. However, it may decide to turn around suddenly and head to sky, not dealing much damage at all.

zipper.desc: The Zipper shoots a ball of energy that sticks to the ground upon impact, repeatedly going the same distance to the right and the left of where you hit, dealing 4 damage every time it touches an enemy. The Zipper will always deal the same amount of damage no matter if the enemy stands to the left, to the right or directly where you hit. Visually the weapon indicates that a perfect hit would increase damage even though it doesn't. With a puny 32 damage against a single target it is better to wait until multiple enemies are grouped up since a guaranteed 32 damage can be dealt to each target, as long as they are within the range of the left-right path.

double_zipper.desc: Double zipper works just like zipper, but has two energy orbs zipping around on the ground. As expected, two orbs mean half damage, dealing only 2 damage at a time.

zipper_quad.desc: Zipper quad has 4 orbs zipping on the ground for quite some time dealing 1 damage each time. Fairly powerful against groups. The yellow zippers travel slightly further than the blue zippers, but not enough to be remotely significant.

bounsplode.desc: Shoots a single Bounsplode projectile that will bounce 9 times before disappearing. While you can use this at long range to do damage, using this at close range and low power can put tanks into large holes along with 90 damage if every explosion hits.

double_bounsplode.desc: Shoots two Bounsplodes at the same time. Each of them will bounce 7 times instead of the usual 9 but the maximum damage output gets a big boost from 90 to 140 making Double-Bounsplode a very powerful early game weapon if used in the right situation.

triple_bounsplode.desc: Shoots three Bounsplodes at the same time, each of which will now bounce 6 times but the damage output becomes even higher with a 40 damage increase from 140 to 180, that’s 20 more damage than a x2 nuke! (but maybe not as much area of effect)

glock.desc: The Glock fires three shots in a row which are not affected by gravity. Each shot that lands deals 10 damage.

m9.desc: M9 is similar to glock, but shoots 5 shots instead of 3. It also has a faster firing rate.

desert_eagle.desc: Desert eagle goes back to 3 shots, but has noticeably more powerful bullets. It is also louder than its other variants.

dead_weight.desc: Once the weapon is fired, it stops once it is vertically

dead_riser.desc: Follows the same rules as Dead Weight, except it has to be vertically

pixel.desc: Fires a large pixel with a pixelated explosion flash. It makes a retro noise when it hits the ground and the trail it makes curves downwards and is also pixelated.

mega_pixel.desc: Mega-Pixel is a very basic upgrade to Pixel, adding 5 more damage and changing the colour from white to a light blue.

super_pixel.desc: The same as Pixel, but deals 10 more damage and takes on a yellow colour instead.

ultra_pixel.desc: The last upgrade for Pixel. Ultra-Pixel deals 15 more damage than Pixel and has a red colour.

builder.desc: The simple builder is still full of uses. It will raise your foes up from the ground, making them easy targets, or it can cover some ground if wind is added. Builder and its Mega variant hit the exact place you hit at with every following bounce, meaning a perfect hit deals full damage. However during the bounce, which is rather high as well, the builder can get influenced by wind, x2, pink barriers, portals and even hit targets. Portals rarely change anything since the weapon goes right back through the portal again, however if the high point of the bounce stays within the portal, it is possible that the Builder land beneath the other portal. It is also possible that you don't do full damage. This is because the damage radius is larger than the terrain increase radius, meaning that you will do damage at first but the Builder then heightens its point of impact, leaving the target behind.

mega_builder.desc: The Mega Builder is what you should bring when you want to raise your enemies up high. A clearly visible enemy is an easy target, and an easy target is an easy win.

construction.desc: Like its Digger counterpart, construction fires 12 builders in a spray pattern that bounces around randomly upon hitting the ground. The amount of terrain created individual projectiles are not very noticeable on their own, but landing several projectiles in the same place can create a hill fairly quickly.

static.desc: This is the most basic of Statics and is unable to make a chain for more than two tanks

static_link.desc: Static Link is a more powerful Static, linking to up to 3 tanks.

static_chain.desc: The strongest Static of them all, linking up to 4 enemy tanks in an electrical shock.

molehill.desc: When molehill hits the ground, it spawns a tunneler like projectile at a random angle with a low power. The angle is independent of how the shot landed, so a 90 degrees shot can result it curving away. Upon reaching the surface, a small hill is made, dealing 50 damage to anyone in the blast radius.

moles.desc: Similar to molehill, but spawns 3 "moles" instead of 1, each dealing 25 damage.

counter_3000.desc: Launches one projectile, after it, two at once, and then three at once. Aiming at a 45 degree angle can let most if not all projectiles land on the same spot, dealing a maximum of 38 damage when used against far range targets.

counter_4000.desc: Adds another volley of shots that contains 4 shots. Basically extending counter 3000.

counter_5000.desc: Adds a fifth volley of 5 shots.

counter_6000.desc: Adds a sixth volley of 6 shots.

hover_ball.desc: Hover-ball acts like a normal shot in terms of flight and impact. What is unique about it is that it turns off gravity at the apex of its arc, causing it to float for .80 seconds before falling down. It has a decent radius and does a good 50 damage.

heavy_hover_ball.desc: Acts just like hover-ball, but hovers 1.00 second and has increased damage and splash radius.

ringer.desc: The most basic version, a small ring is created at the shot's landing spot. However, a miss is required to deal damage because damage is only dealt in the circumference of the ring. If you were to shoot at 90 degrees in the air, the ring will reach approximately 1/3 of your aiming circle.

heavy_ringer.desc: This one is noticeably bigger, and the damage has increased to 50. However, because of the increased radius, you will need to aim more to the sides. If you were to shoot 90 degrees in the air, this ring will reach approximately 2/3 of your aiming circle.

olympic_ringer.desc: This one is right in the middle between ringer and heavy ringer. It creates 5 identical rings that deal 15 damage each, for a total of 75, so try not to miss. These rings have the same radius and reaches approximately 1/2 of your aiming circle.

rainbow.desc: Rainbow shoots 6 shots colored in fashion similar to a rainbow. The shots are shot at the same power, but are stacked on top of each other, giving it that arcing rainbow appearance in most shots. The shots goes through terrain, making it an excellent weapon to finish off weakened foes. Damage is distance based.

megarainbow.desc: If Rainbow wasn't big enough, MegaRainbow should be. With increased damage and size, MegaRainbows can hit harder and has a slightly easier time hitting.

moons.desc: Shoots 5 Moons that starts to fly like a normal shot, before starting to fly around with no specific flight pattern until it leaves the map or hits the ground. It deals damage depending on the distance traveled.

orbitals.desc: Orbitals just adds more Moons that fly around for more randomness and wacky flight patterns! Each moon does slightly less damage, though.

mini_pinger.desc: Upon hitting the ground, Mini-Pinger will send 3 yellow projectiles straight up into the air with a random angle. They will travel beyond the top of the map, before returning down to the ground. The projectiles are affected by wind. Because they travel a long distance even small winds may influence them. One thing to note is that if the projectiles are unable to make it past the top of the screen before hitting the ground, they will do nothing upon impact. This will happen if the initial shot lands underneath a bumper.

pinger.desc: Just like Mini-Pinger, Pinger will send 3 yellow projectiles, following which will come 3 green projectiles. All behave in the same manner, but the green projectiles will deal more damage.

ping_flood.desc: Final tier will send not only the yellow and green "pings", but also a set of 3 blue shots at the end. Again, this will shoot at random angles and is affected by wind, so be wary.

shank.desc: A short Shank comes out of your Tank barrel and stabs any enemy it hits, it does not alter the terrain but it can pass through it. Though the effect radius is not clearly determinable, there is a practical trick which helps you calculate whether Shank will hit your target or not, based on the length of your shot bar (the "white part" of your shot bar, which can be calculated in "power units" ranging from power 0 to power 100). Specifically, if the distance between you and your target is less than ~29 "power units", Shank will hit its target.

dagger.desc: Is the tank too far for the Shank to reach it? Well, there's a solution for that! The Dagger can reach further than the Shank can for the same amount of damage. Using the above trick to determine whether your Dagger will hit or miss, you will find out that Dagger will hit its mark as long as the distance between you and your enemy is less than ~46 "power units".

sword.desc: Even bigger than a Dagger, with a maximum range of effect around 63 "power units". Use it against many opponents lined up for max efficiency!

bolt.desc: As a simple tier 1 weapon should be , you start with a flare that calls down a single lightning bolt to the area where it lands, dealing 30 damage in the process accompanied by the sound of thunder.

lightning.desc: They say a lightning never strikes the same place twice, and they're right. It'll strike the same place thrice! This tier 2 upgrade makes your flare call 3 lightning strikes instead of one that deal 20 damage each strike with a total of 60 damage.

2012.desc: It is the end of the world and so are your enemies lives. This final tier not only shoots three bolts like the second tier but also leaves flames AND calls down asteroids from the sky, annihilating anything they strike upon. If all the bolts hit, and the flames hit the same target twice, and all the asteroids hit, you can do 126 damage.

gravies.desc: Fires a vertical line of projectiles with various sizes and colors. They do the same amount of damage at the same ranges. On an 89 degree angle on either side, this weapon can prove to be effective at digging the opponent downwards. Damage is based on distance.

gravits.desc: Adds two more projectiles to the line, covering more area than before.

spiker.desc: A normal projectile is fired. Upon hitting the ground, 5 gray beams will spawn, one after another, evenly spaced, and perpendicular to the ground where they spawned. The beams start spawning from where the initial projectile lands and continue to spawn in the same direction the initial projectile was traveling. After all the beams have spawned, a spike-like projectile launches from each beam, perpendicular to the ground, causing small explosions and dealing damage.

super_spiker.desc: Identical to the first level of Spiker. However, more beams spawn on the ground, adding more spikes with the same damage, increasing damage output.

disco_ball.desc: Drops a ball and acts in a similar way to

groovy_ball.desc: DRAMA ALERT! The ball has truly dropped with this weapon with an epic entrance. The ball dangles, then falls off its laser thread, exploding for a mediocre amount of damage, throwing out shrapnel shards when it lands. If the ball happens to land on an enemy that is on the bottom of the map, all shards explode instantly in a manner similar to shrapnel and can deal heavy damage.

boomerang.desc: Fires a boomerang shot, which has a constant acceleration in the x direction. The amount of acceleration is proportional to the x component of the initial velocity (which is the "force" of the shot), and the direction is always opposed to the shot. At 100/45, it is equivalent to about 500 wind. Damage is distance based.

big_boomerang.desc: Almost the same as the above, but with a slightly higher damage cap, and a bigger explosion once the shot hits the ground.

tadpoles.desc: Fires many small, green projectiles. When they hit the ground, they bounce around a bit and then explode. They can explode early if they hit an enemy, also dealing damage. Damage is distance based.

frogs.desc: Similar to Tadpoles, but the projectiles are larger and emit croaking sounds like that of a frog or toad.

bullfrog.desc: Similar to Frogs, but also shoots one larger projectile that deals around 4 times the damage of the smaller projectiles it comes with.

mini_v.desc: When the Mini-V comes into contact with the ground, six projectiles shoot up from the impact site. Three of these projectiles dodge a little to the left and the others slide to the right. Usually for a direct hit, four projectiles smash into the tank, each doling out 15 damage for a respectable "average" of 60 damage.

flying_v.desc: Acts the same way as the Mini-V but more projectiles are launched and they ascend higher.

yin_yang.desc: A projectile similar to Big Shot is shot like normal, with a tunneling projectile shot at an angle mirrored over the horizontal line of the aiming circle. Although this weapon might not do much, it certainly looks cool under the right circumstances. Firing at a negative angle will allow the "tunneler" portion of the shot to be fired above ground and act similarly to a standard tunneler, but the "shot" portion may damage you.

yin_yang_yong.desc: Adds a projectile that looks like a Yin and Yang symbol, which travels horizontally from the tank. The projectile travels through the ground.

fireworks.desc: This weapon shoots out 3 firework rockets that explode into multiple shots, each doing 8 damage. The rockets explode when they hit the top of their arc, meaning it is possible for the following projectiles to spawn inside a circle bumper. Be warned, as the rockets do not explode and will not do damage if they collide with the terrain before they have a chance to explode. This weapon and upgrades can easily be rendered useless if the shot happens to land at the same spot and time as a bulger or any weapon that creates terrain when it lands.

grand_finale.desc: The same as fireworks, but adds two more firework rockets, boosting average damage done. If the player is lucky enough, it can do 100+ damage to a single enemy.

pyrotechnics.desc: Puts on a spectacular fireworks display, this weapon is both majestic and destructive. Upon landing, a number of sparkling particles is launched in the air over a wide area. Afterwards, a blue rocket goes straight up as 2 red rockets and 2 white rockets fan out from both sides. The rockets explode in a symmetric pattern from bottom to top, completing the display. When used against groups, it can easily do over 100 damage. When against a single enemy, it is still recommended to use grand finale if choose weapon level is turned on.

water_balloon.desc: The Water Balloon is a very random weapon that can deal a decent chunk of damage if you get lucky. When shot, it will choose a random flight path that is within a couple degrees of a normal flying shot, bounce a small distance with random amount of times on the ground and once done, it explodes into a spray of 10 water projectiles that spreads to both sides, dealing distance scaled damage. Only the water from the balloons deal damage, as any balloon impacts does nothing. Due to its random nature, it is advised to use this weapon against groups, where hitting the general area is enough. It is worth noting that the water balloon may not bounce at all and explode once it hits the ground. This tends to happen more often if the balloon lands near an enemy tank.

water_trio.desc: Water Trio follows most of Water Balloons rules with few exceptions. The damage maximum per projectile has been reduced by 1 and 3 balloons are shot that deviate from the actual trajectory even more, making groups a crucial part in dealing good amounts of damage with this weapon.

water_fight.desc: Water Fight is the reward for dedicated spraying and praying. It fires 10 Water Balloons, that stick surprisingly close together covering about the same deviation from the normal flight path as the previous ones. An interesting change here is that each Water Balloon now only contains 5 water projectiles and those have their max damage reduced to 6. Remember how you got here and pop those balloons like a monkey.

magnets.desc: A large magnet is fired, which spawns many other magnets in a V formation when it hits the ground. The sides of the V reverse by the time they all hit the ground.

attractoids.desc: There is no initial projectile -- instead, lots of small magnets slowly fall and are attracted to the tanks on the battlefield. They tend to target tanks that are higher up. Most effective when only one enemy is left.

arrow.desc: It is one of the weapons that deals great damage needs great precision much like the

bow_&_arrow.desc: Whats the point of keeping the bow after you ran out of ammo? How about throwing it as well to deal more extra damage! Just like the arrow, the bow is also distance based ranging from 4 to 10 damage. It has also a bigger radius than the arrow so the bow can still deal damage even if your arrow missed the target slightly.

flaming_arrow.desc: The final tier shoots only the arrow and not the bow, but increases linger damage from 2 to 5 due to the flaming tip of the arrow. There is no change to the arrow itself, but the increased linger damage is not affected by distance making it deadly even in close range.

driller.desc: Driller will explode upon impact and then create 4 explosions that get smaller per explosion directly beneath the first explosion instantly, creating a hole in the shape of a cone. Since the weapon goes straight downward and all explosions deal equal damage it is important that you hit the middle of the enemy tank for full damage.

slammer.desc: Come on and slam and welcome to the jam. The Slammer explodes on impact, dealing no damage to the terrain, and then jumps 90 degrees into the air, during which it can be influenced by barriers, portals, x2, wind and can hit targets. If a portal is at the high point you might land beneath the other portal and miss. Once it lands, or better slams back down at accelerated speed it shows its true face, dealing the larger portion of the damage upon a big explosion area.

quicksand.desc: One of the few weapons that is difficult to use properly, 30 small sand particles are launched in rapid succession from the tank. They pass through terrain for a bit before exploding, causing large holes to form in the terrain above and damaging tanks above it. Because the particles have a bit of spread, higher angles should be used for maximizing damage. Additionally, higher angles can easily trap opponents in a deep pit, making higher angle shots better.

desert.desc: The same as quicksand, but shoots more projectiles and can cause more damage to tanks and the terrain.

jumper.desc: The first shot of the weapon is completely normal up until it is almost about to hit the ground.  Right at that moment, a new shot forms out of the original one and makes a small shot that goes further away. Both the original and newly created shots do 20 damage and have a decent sized blast radius.

triple_jumper.desc: This tier acquires the same attributes as tier one, except it makes 3 extra shots instead of one. All new projectiles forming off of the newly created ones. Again, all of these shots do 20 damage and have a decently sized blast radius.

spaz.desc: The ultimate random number generator weapon, this weapon has random damage, random splash radius, and a semi-random travel path. It can be fairly good or horrible, depending on your luck. Be warned, as there is  a small chance of this weapon landing 0 damage, complete with the number 0 appearing above your target and a +0 xp on your screen, similar to shots that hit players but did not hit bumpers in rebound mode.

spazzer.desc: Same as the previous tier, but seems to act more erratic.

spaztastic.desc: Same as the previous tiers, but seems to act even more erratic.

pinata.desc: In the location that the initial flare is fired, a pinata falls into the battlefield accompanied by special music. The pinata then bursts and 16 projectiles in various patterns and colors are released. While most of the patterns spray across a wider area doing little damage, you can get lucky and have all projectiles hit very close to where the flare hit, potentially even hitting them all. This is extremely rare but for this alone it is worth trying to land the flare perfectly on an enemy.

fiesta.desc: Congratulations on making it this far. You suffered through so many Pinatas that you get 2 extra Pinatas to fire at once. The amount of projectiles and damage per projectile are reduced but tripling the amount of pinatas leads to a lot more total projectiles flying around. Before the Pinatas explode the 3 flares have to land first. If you fire at a 45 degree angle the flares will land very close together and thus the general spread isn't as bad.

shockwave.desc: Once used, the tank will emit a powerful blue shockwave which will hit any tank close to you. All tanks, dead or alive and in its range will transmit the shockwave further. Shockwave is unable to chain to other tanks if only living allies are in range. Tanks can be damaged only once by the same attack. This weapon ignores all landscape, bumpers, portals, and buffs; but can be absorbed by black holes if a player is sitting inside of a black hole.

sonic_pulse.desc: Like Shockwave, the tank will start a chain reaction, with a small range upgrade and a green color. But this time, any living allies in its range can also transmit the shockwave further, also ignoring landscape, bumpers, portals and buffs

bounder.desc: After a Bounder touches the ground, it bounces to the nearest enemy available, however, it doesn't consider any terrain changes, elevation differences, bumpers, and portals on its path, which can ruin its locked position.

double_bounder.desc: The more the merrier. Double Bounder will shoot 2 Bounders, each dealing 20 damage per hit. This can make you hit 2 tanks instead of one.

triple_bounder.desc: Similarly to the other two, Triple Bounder shoots 3 Bounders that deal 15 damage each.

uzi.desc: A submachine gun. This weapon fires ten bullets that deals 5 damage per bullet to your enemies. As for every

mp5.desc: The 2nd tier of the submachine gun family, the MP5 still deals 5 damage per shot but fires a dozen bullets instead, dealing a total of 60 damage to your foes.

p90.desc: Deals slightly less damage per shot, but adds noticeably more bullets. Because of the spread that is shared with all weapons in this family, it is recommended to use this weapon at close range.

sticky_bomb.desc: A single projectile is fired, releasing red smoke as it travels. When it hits the ground, a clicking sound is emitted and 2 seconds later it explodes.

sticky_trio.desc: Launches three sticky bombs in a similar fashion to three-ball. If all three bombs land at the same place, a deep hole can be dug, which can be set up for friendly flares.

mine_layer.desc: Shoots a projectile that bounces around on the ground, leaving a mine on the ground when it does so. After 5 bounces, all mines and the projectile itself explode at once. The damage is distance based, so try to aim for enemies that are further away.

sticky_rain.desc: Sticky rain is a flare type weapon just like the final tier of grenade. When it comes to a rest, a number of small sticky bombs rain down from the sky. The sticky bombs make a line as they land, and explode one by one in a chain reaction.

fleet.desc: A fleet of 11 light blue, triangular projectiles are fired in a formation.

heavy_fleet.desc: Heavy Fleet adds a row of 9 slightly darker blue

super_fleet.desc: Super Fleet adds a row of 7 even darker blue projectiles to the previous tier, but deals less damage. This gets to the point where the Fleet family can destroy a fair amount of terrain, capable of hitting enemies behind small walls.

squadron.desc: Squadron adds a row of 5 blue-violet projectiles to the previous tier, and it deals the same amount of damage (per projectile) as its predecessor. As before, good amounts of terrain can be broken with this weapon.

rain.desc: A blue flare is launched from the tank. It causes a storm cloud to appear above it, and lots of small rain drops fall from the cloud.

hail.desc: When your enemies meet the freezing embrace of this hail, they will want to find shelter, but there will be none. Hail increases damage to more than double from rain, but halves the number of projectiles rained down. The question is, what is colder? This weapon or the heart of its user?

sillyballs.desc: Shoots 9 balls in a 3x3 grid that bounce around the terrain in a similar manner to flares, but will explode upon landing on an enemy. It will also explode if it comes to a rest.

wackyballs.desc: Adds 3 more balls to the grid, but deals slightly less damage because of the added balls.

crazyballs.desc: Shoots even more balls that do slightly less damage than wackyballs.

napalm.desc: A small flaming projectile is fired. When it gets near to the ground, it bursts into a fan of 11 flame projectiles in a shotgun fashion.

heavy_napalm.desc: Same as napalm, but has bigger fire particles and does more damage.

firestorm.desc: Compresses all your rage and leftover napalm into an ungodly apocalypse style weapon, it is one of the strongest weapons in the game. Firestorm fires a flare that drops flaming meteors that explode, leaving damaging fire. After about five seconds, the tank shoots two bounsplode-like rocks at the same power and angle, dealing more damage.

saw_blade.desc: Much like the Roller weapons, the Saw Blade cruises on the ground after it lands, continuing in the direction it was going. The differences are that Saw Blade has a longer lifetime that increases distance, moves faster, and can pierce through multiple enemies dealing 30 damage per tank.

rip_saw.desc: As expected from the upgrade of the Saw Blade, the Rip Saw travels longer than its predecessor, dealing more damage over a larger distance.

diamond_blade.desc: This is the final tier where the blade receives a significant duration time boost, as well as increased damage.

sunburst.desc: As simple as it is, a direct shot from a Sunburst can be deadly. Shooting shiny rays of sparking sun outwards in a circle, this weapon is best used on enemies on flat land or elevated peaks. Upon Impact, Sunburst will burst out 24 seperate projectiles, that will then come back to their origin, damaging your unlucky foes. Damage for this weapon is distance based.

solar_flare.desc: The upgraded Sunburst works just like the original, with an addition of long-range sparks. Shot together with the ones that come back, these will instead travel straight until they hit something, or disappear due to timeout, as they will bounce off the edge of the screen, similar to Seagull or Bouncy Ball. If you manage to hit any of these your enemies will receive 30 damage - enough to bring them out of the dark side.

synclets.desc: Synclets sprays a bunch of green projectiles in the general area of where you aimed at. These projectiles stop shortly before they hit the ground until all of them are stopped in mid-air, at which point they instantly all continue their normal flight path together in one coordinated strike. The exception to this is almost instantly hitting an enemy or the ground, which will do the normal damage, but only look half as cool.

super_synclets.desc: Fires more synclets, for a bigger strike and more damage.

payload.desc: Fires a shot which drops a 60 damage "payload" onto a target at the peak of the arc. Great for close range shooting, but requires a unique aim point to succeed, making sure the shot arcs exactly over the target. If it bounces off a bumper into another arc, it will drop another payload.

magic_shower.desc: Fires a shot which continuously drops payloads as the shot flies, exceptionally powerful at close range, when fired high, at high power. Behind Scavengers, this is the most powerful weapon in the game against a single target with a maximum damage of 300. To survive firing it at 100,90, combine it with a shield or simply use it as a last resort to draw a tie.

darkshadow.desc: A minor upgrade from the Shadow. Deals 5 more damage and has a slightly larger explosion radius.

deathshadow.desc: A minor upgrade from the Darkshadow. Deals 5 more damage and has a slightly larger explosion radius.

x_attack.desc: This weapon fires a large amount of shots in the shape of an "X". Because the "X" has considerable spread, it is advised to treat this weapon like a shotgun, using it at close range. Damage is distance based.

o_attack.desc: Fires shots in the shape of an "O". If used at close range, it can deal around 100 damage.

carpet_bomb.desc: A flare is fired, bouncing along the ground until it comes to a stop. Around that location, 15 bombs will start falling from the sky consecutively dealing 7 damage per blast. The bombs drop at an angle, so it will depend on the terrain where they land. The flatter the terrain is, the closer the bombs will land from each other. Unlike

carpet_fire.desc: The second tier of Carpet Bombs, there is no significant change in this tier other than the increase of bombs dropped. The more the better!

incendiary_bombs.desc: The third and final tier is where the real change happens. First off, the attack starts dropping the shells like normal, except there are flames that remain on where the shells landed, dealing  an additional 2 damage each.

baby_seagull.desc: The cute Baby Seagull already packs quite the punch. Once unleashed into the air it will poop a projectile every second, that will still have some of the angular momentum of the Seagull itself but quickly falls straight down. These poop projectiles scale damage with distance while the Baby Seagull itself always does 20 damage. It is interesting to note that

seagull.desc: They say his name is Steven. The adult Seagull packs a more powerful punch, with increased poop and direct damage and slightly increasing explosion radius but follows the same mechanic as the previous tier. There is no chance in the pooping rate. Be careful if you're in the back of your team since there are higher chances of you hitting them due to bigger explosion radius.

mama_seagull.desc: Mother of Gulls! Big Mama Seagull is just like its children but with a stronger punch with the increased damage and more destruction with yet another increased blast radius making it the most deadly out of the three. If shot at 100,90 it can do at least 136 damage to you and the person you're in with. If the enemy is not directly with you, the poops deal +1 damage due to the fact that they are distance based.

shrapnel.desc: When this grenade explodes, it creates 30 fragments which rapidly fly in all directions. If the grenade falls on the middle of a tank some of the fragments instantly deal damage, but others fly away. it deals maximum damage if the tank is located on the bottom of the map.

shredders.desc: The shrapnel don't deal enough damage? Upgrade it to shredders! It creates 40 fragments instead of 30, but the damage is the same. The thing is, it deals up to 250 damage if all the fragments impact...

penetrator.desc: Penetrator shoots a shot that bounces around the terrain. When it bounces, it creates a tunneler-like projectile that mirrors the bounce direction and has the same power. Because penetrator does not do damage on impact, it is fairly hard to use effectively. However, if used against enemies on the bottom of the map or on flat land, a shot one-third the distance between you and your enemy will result in most if not all projectiles hitting dealing a good amount of damage. It is also important to note that shooting penetrator too high will cause the underground projectiles to despawn.

penetrator_v2.desc: Same as the penetrator, but bounces more. Shooting at one-third the distance between you and your target will still work at the bottom of the map or on flat land.

jammer.desc: Various music notes are fired from the tank with some amount of spread in rapid succession. Upon hitting the ground, a random tone is played.

jiver.desc: Adds in more projectiles with damage unchanged.

rocker.desc: The most music one can produce. Adds more notes with unchanged damage.

chunklet.desc: Chunklet creates a large projectile, but leaves a fairly small explosion for its size. Chunklet follows a normal trajectory hitting enemies for 45 damage.

chunker.desc: Chunker also follows a normal trajectory, but has a massive projectile, which also leaves a small explosion compared to the size.

bouncy_ball.desc: Upon hitting the ground, it bounces itself around the arena 5 times, increasing its velocity with each hit. If it hits the sides of the map, it will bounce back instead of falling out. It is difficult to hit with it, but rewarding. Damage is based on the distance between your tank and the enemy tank.

super_ball.desc: The highest single projectile damage in the game, it packs an enormous punch, if you can hit it.

minions.desc: Minions can be considered as an interesting variant of rollers and back rollers. Minions shoots 2 rollers and 2 back rollers that all converge to where a normal shot would have landed.

many_minions.desc: Same as minions, but adds 1 roller to both sides, making it 3 rollers and 3 back rollers.

battering_ram.desc: This is the basic weapon of the Battering Ram family. A single purple orb is fired, and sharply curves downward after reaching the apex of the shot. It creates a small terrain-damaging explosion on impact. Damage is varied based on the distance traveled. Close-up shots will do about 22 base damage to every tank caught in the explosion, but shots from across the screen will do 50 base damage.

double_ram.desc: The Double Ram will deal a maximum damage of 35 on long distances upon impact, then jump randomly into the air and land again closeby, doing another 35 maximum damage.

ram_squad.desc: The same as battering ram, but shoots 5 rams in rapid succession. The rams are shot with a slight variation in power for each ram.

double_ram_squad.desc: Same as ram-squad, but all rams act like double ram, hitting the ground twice.

asteroids.desc: This is the base weapon of the Asteroids family. Four asteroids are fired, deviating slightly from the set power and angle. The explosion is roughly the size of two tanks and damages the terrain on impact. Base damage dealt is varied based on how far the asteroids travel. Close-up shots do about 7 base damage per enemy tank per explosion, whereas shots from across the screen can do more than 18 base damage per enemy tank per explosion. It should be noted that asteroids and comets travel slightly slower than normal shots.

comets.desc: Comets increase the maximum damage of the projectiles to 20 while adding an extra projectile for a total base damage of 100

asteroid_storm.desc: Shoots a flare that summons 4 asteroids from above like the way

spider.desc: The base level weapon. Extends 3 branches from the landing site, and finishes with 12 sub-branches. Being hit by any of these branches causes 25 base damage.

tarantula.desc: Similar to spider, but does less damage, and it finishes with 18 sub-branches,  allowing potentially more hits. Each branch and sub-branch travels farther than spider.

daddy_longlegs.desc: Daddy Longlegs, like the name suggests, has its "spider legs" reach out noticeably farther than any other variant. It splits only twice, which is the least out of all variants, but finishes with 25 sub-branches.

black_widow.desc: Black Widow goes back to the normal reach of spiders. Although damage is reduced to 14, it splits four times, which is the most out of all variants. It finishes with 36 sub-branches, so it tends to completely block out the area where the shot is landed.

rampage.desc: Rampage is a weapon that sends several projectiles that travels in wide-reaching sine waves from the player's position to the opposite end of the screen, dealing 15 damage per hit. It completely ignores the player's currently set power and only uses angle to determine which side travel towards. Any enemy that the projectiles run into will be hit, although the projectiles will stop "rampaging" after a while, dealing damage to any tanks they hit. However, Rampage and Riot will never hit any ally while they are still traveling.

riot.desc: Unlocked after earning 2,000 XP using Rampage. It adds 2 more sine-wave projectiles and does the same damage as rampage.

m4.desc: Fires 8 bullets that deal 6 damage each, the difference in the distance where it was shot does not matter.

m16.desc: Fires 6 bullets that deal 10 damage each, the difference in the distance where it was shot does not matter.

ak_47.desc: Basically a straight upgrade from M4 with the same fire rate and projectiles and increased damage.

clover.desc: Has a random chance to explode on impact for a large amount of damage, around 25%. Otherwise it will do near to no damage.

four_leaf_clover.desc: A direct upgrade of the previous clover, with an increased explosion chance of around 40%.

3d_bomb.desc: Fires a single metal ball that flies on the 3D-plane. The projectile moves closer to the screen as it rises and goes further as it falls. It can pass through the ground just like

2x3d.desc: Fires two of the same sized projectile with less damage of 30 per ball but has increased total damage of 60. This is a good weapon for making holes.

3x3d.desc: As the name states the final tier shoots 3 3D-Bombs with further decreased damage of 25 but has an increased overall damage of 75. Creates an enormous pit when fired under the terrain, also deals a large amount of damage, this weapon deals the largest vertical terrain damage in the game, only beaten by

snowball.desc: A tiny snowball is fired and grows in size every time it hits the ground. The larger it is when it hits an enemy, the more damage is dealt. If it becomes too large, it will explode upon hitting the ground.

snowstorm.desc: Shoots a flare that summons 3 snowballs from the sky.

spotter.desc: Ever think a sniper shot is very boring? This weapon makes things a little more interesting. When this weapon hits, it creates a ring with spike-like projectiles that converge into the shot's landing spot. Although a slight miss will still result in damage, it is best to aim for direct hits, as that is when the weapon is most effective. At long ranges, spotter has the potential to do 100+ damage. A word of warning: spotter does not do damage immediately, so if a teammate (or enemy) moves your target, it can cause your shot to miss.

spotter_xl.desc: The same as spotter, but circles more around the shot's landing place, adding more damage.

spotter_xxl.desc: Same as spotter, but circles even more and adds in even more damage.

fighter_jet.desc: The tank shoots the jet like a normal shot. When the jet reaches its highest altitude it shoots 4 rockets one by one. Each rocket locks in the enemy who is nearest to the Jet at the time the rocket is shot, and if there are no obstacles in the way the rocket hits that enemy. If you manage to make the jet crash into a tank, it deals damage depending on the distance it has traveled before crashing. If launched in a 90-degree angle without wind, the jet will always fly to the east of the field. If the missile gets hit by a bumper at flight it will try to correct itself and lock on the tank again. Depending on the situation it will just hit the ground as it tries to lock onto the enemy.

heavy_jet.desc: The mechanics of Heavy Jet are identical to those of Fighter Jet, with the exception of the Jet's explosion radius being bigger and increased damage for every rocket.

bounstrike.desc: Bounstrike shoots a flare when used. Upon resting, 8 sillyballs in an organized line fall down from the sky and bounce around until they hit someone or explode after a certain time (specifically after the balls have bounced off the ground a combined total of 30 times). Bounstrike and its stronger variations can be surprisingly effective if you can work well and combo it with teammates. Damage per projectile is based on the distance between you and the enemy tank.

bounstream.desc: Bounstream reduces the maximum damage done, but adds in significantly more sillyballs, resulting in higher average damage done. They bounce off the ground up to 40 times before exploding on impact.

bounstorm.desc: Bounstorm adds in a large amount of sillyballs to the point where the sillyballs are touching side by side. Again, maximum damage done is reduced due to the increased amount of sillyballs. They bounce off the ground up to 50 times before exploding on impact.

starfire.desc: Shoots 6 stars one by one with a bit of spread. The stars have a small explosion radius, allowing for slight misses. The damage is distance based.

shooting_star.desc: Pray to your lucky stars that this weapon hits. A star shaped flare is shot. Upon resting, a huge star flies downwards into the screen and crashes into the ground, dealing a good amount of damage. However, shooting star can land in a large variety of places. The flare that you shoot only marks the general area of where the star lands. In fact, it is somewhat rare for the star to land where the flare rests, so a miss with the flare is not really a bad thing.

bee_hive.desc: This weapon shoots out a small beehive that summons a swarm of bees when it lands. The bees will fly out and around the hive's landing area. The bees do go through the terrain, so a miss with the hive may still do some damage. The hive itself does not deal any damage and the 12 bees it spawns deal 10 damage each. Since the bees fly around at random, covering a wide area, you will miss a few against a single target. If possible wait for enemies to get closer together before firing and otherwise use this if someone hides behind a thin wall or if you know you will hit closeby but most likely not perfectly, since this doesn't really make a difference for the expected damage.

killer_bees.desc: Killer bees act just like bee hive, but adds 3 more bees and the bees spread out further.

wasps.desc: Wasps adds 3 more bees and has the bees spread even further than before. Wasps do have very good damage potential, capable of doing ~100 damage on a direct hit with the hive.

dual_roller.desc: The player shoots a single, very colorful Roller that can make people confused on their first shot wondering whether it will roll forward or backward. But upon impact that can deal 20 damage, it splits up to two smaller rollers moving in both directions dealing 20 more damage each. Be careful though as it can jump past enemies that are too close to the initial impact.

spreader.desc: The second and final tier turns the initial shot to a flare that looks more identical to its icon, upon landing, 9 green rollers will fall down from the sky, the first 4 moving left, the middle one staying in place, and the last four moving on the right. Some rollers move faster than the others but they all have the same lifespan and damage

partition.desc: Shoots a shot that summons in a blinding column of light that strikes 6 times. It is capable of hitting multiple enemies at once and does not damage terrain.

division.desc: Same as partition, but creates a bigger beam of light and has a fairly abusive AOE, damaging enemies that are close to the shot's landing place but not even in the light column at all.

bfg_1000.desc: This weapon is essentially a basic explosive shot with a decent radius. This weapon travels noticeably slower than other weapons when shot. Damage is distance-based. This weapon and its upgrade will land a tiny bit closer than a normal shot.

bfg_9000.desc: Same as BFG-1000, but shoots a much bigger version and has increased damage and splash radius.

train.desc: Shoots a train composed of 8 segments.They function like the

express.desc: The same as train, but adds more train segments and has slightly reduced damage for each segment. Total damage done however, is more than train.

mini_turret.desc: The small Turret is a deployable mini weapon that will try its best to aim for you. Once it hits the ground, this weapon will create an automated turret, that will shoot three bursts of five shots in the direction of the nearest enemy. It's accuracy isn't the greatest, so the closer it lands, the higher the chance that all the shots will hit. Once the turret has used up all it's ammunition, it will self-destruct, creating a small crater and damaging enemies in range.

turret_mob.desc: Do you love the Mini-Turret? Do you wish you could shoot more at once? Well say no more! Turret Mob will deploy 3 Mini-Turrets, each doing slightly less damage, but if all land close enough to an enemy the total is higher. Or you can hit 3 enemies spread around the map!

kamikaze.desc: After the flare vanishes,  bullets will start hitting the ground from the sky, dealing 15 damage per bullet and breaking a fair amount of ground. Afterwards the plane shooting the bullets will be visible and can be seen flying downwards near the area, crashing into the ground, dealing 50 damage and a large crater will be left where it exploded.

suicide_bomber.desc: Essentially the same as kamikaze, except that suicide bomber fires a lot more bullets.

nuke.desc: The weapon to end all weapons. Nuke features a massive explosion that is sure to be a spectacular sight. It is rare for a Nuke to not be greeted by the cries of its many angry victims. Great to use in team modes since it can hit multiple enemies even if they aren't standing close together. If you deal critical damage to one target within the blast radius you deal that damage to everyone within the blast radius, at the same time. This weapon has shown inconsistencies in the Assassin gamemode, sometimes killing multiple enemies and sometimes only one. The Nuke is also one of the most reliable ways to destroy massive amounts of terrain, eating up the map in its gargantuan radius. The Nuke explodes on impact.

meganuke.desc: The MegaNuke is the Nukes bigger badder brother, increasing the damage by 20 (+25%) and the blast radius by just over 27%. It is functionally equal to the Nuke, only with more general BOOM. As a guaranteed 100 Damage weapon the MegaNuke can be a reliable way to take away a sizable chunk of health from your targets.

black_hole.desc: This weapon will summon a black hole on impact, constantly doing damage and acts in a similar fashion to the

cosmic_rift.desc: This larger version of the Black Hole has a larger radius, and will last for slightly longer, dealing more damage.

bumper_bombs.desc: Bumper Bombs take a new approach to utilizing bumpers. When fired, the projectiles will actually move TOWARDS the player with the angle being a mirrored version of the initial angle. Right before the projectiles hit the player, an invisible one-time use bumper rebounds all shots in the direction of the intended shot. There are two types of projectiles fired. The first (white-tailed) is a basic explosive and detonates on impact. The second (purple-tailed) is a bouncing explosive that acts similarly to a one-bounce, dealing damage after hitting the ground once. Unlike the one-bounce however, these explosives will explode immediately if they hit an enemy. In the first tier, these appear yellow. All projectiles are subject to distance-scaled damage.

bumper_array.desc: Similar to the first tier, but the projectiles are smaller, green, and there are more projectiles shot. The fire rate is also significantly slower than the first tier.

bumper_assault.desc: Similar to the prior tiers, but the projectiles are red and there are more fired.

breakermania.desc: Adds another set of breaking to BreakerMadness, so it breaks further into 64 projectiles.

homing_missile.desc: This weapon will fire a single missile, which will target the closest enemy at the top of its arc and then aim for them. Should the target be on the opposite side of which the missile is fired, it will quickly rush over before falling down in a fashion similar to dead weight.

homing_rockets.desc: Fires 2 rockets at once that behave exactly as before.

puzzler.desc: Upon hitting an area, Puzzler will deal 10 damage, just like the standard

deceiver.desc: Fires randomly dispersed explosions around hit area, it is a clone of the previous edition with increased average damage

baffler.desc: The final upgrade of puzzler, it is sparadic and deals highly varied damage

rocket_fire.desc: This weapon will send 4 rockets at your enemies, which will vaguely follow the shot arc, flying slightly right and left of it.

rocket_cluster.desc: Similarly to the previous Tier, it will send multiple rockets at your enemies, all vaguely following the shot arc.

flurry.desc: This weapon will send an avalanche of rockets at your enemies, all acting similarly to the previous Tiers.

pentagram.desc: Shoots a red flame that summons a pentagram. When it is summoned, the pentagram turns while a red ball traces the lines of the pentagram and makes explosions at each corner. Each explosion does 20 damage each. The pentagram disappears when then red ball traces the entire pentagram.

pentaslam.desc: Works the same as the first tier, but after the ball completes its cycle the whole pentagram explodes instead of imploding, dealing 15 damage on its large explosion radius.

radar.desc: This weapon shoots like a normal shot, however it will scan the area around it's arc for players. If the white line hits an enemy, it will lock a green ball onto them, which will explode after a few seconds.

sonar.desc: An upgrade from Radar, it will increase the range of the scanner.

lidar.desc: This upgrade is the same as Sonar, but it increases the damage to 60.

laser_beam.desc: Fires a small width, penetrating beam that deals high damage. It can pass through terrain and does not arc, ignoring anything in its path. Any enemies that are "stacked" on top of the player will also be hit when the laser is fired. Any friendly tanks will not be damaged by the beam.

great_beam.desc: Fires a larger, blue beam with a slight damage increase.

ultra_beam.desc: Fires an even larger, yellow beam with another damage increase. This is when the laser starts to get a lot of width and is capable of hitting enemies who are slightly away from the rest of the enemies who may be in a line.

master_beam.desc: The largest laser possible to fire. This purple colored beam is fairly wide and can hit several enemies who are not in a completely straight line.

tweeter.desc: Shoots a small speaker that has a small explosion radius. It makes a chirping sound similar to

squawker.desc: Shoots a speaker that has a larger range and lower pitch than Tweeter. Damage is also increased but hits fewer times.

woofer.desc: Has a moderate range and has a very low pitch. Damage is again increased and number of hits is also reduced.

acid_rain.desc: Just like the original rain, this weapon will summon a rain cloud, which will drop acid projectiles straight down on the ground. They burn similarly to flame, causing more damage than rain. If all the drops miraculously hit a tank at distance, it can do 240 damage.

acid_hail.desc: Shoots fewer projectiles than its first tier, but each projectile does more damage. At range, acid hail can do up to 264 damage.

sunflower.desc: Fires an exponentially dividing flower seed that rains more seeds on the opponent

helianthus.desc: Fires a larger seed that divides more and can deal an enourmous ammount of damage

taser.desc: Shoots a yellow and a blue projectile. When both projectiles hit the ground, a blue bolt in the form of a straight line will be created between the projectiles. The bolt goes through terrain, tanks, bumpers, and everything else, and does 75 damage.

heavy_taser.desc: Similar to Taser, but creates a yellow bolt instead of a blue bolt. The bolt is slightly wider than that of Taser, and it does 85 damage.

sausage.desc: Shoots a chain of sausage-shaped explosions that go through terrain and are effected by gravity, similar to

bratwurst.desc: Similar to the first tier, but the sausages are smaller, making it easier to do more damage.

kielbasa.desc: Again similar to the first tier, but the sausages are even smaller.

jackpot.desc: Increases in damage at a rate of 25 damage per second in the air, if the number exceeds 100, it will deal 1 damage. Jackpot's color is a light-green with yellow sparkles.

mega_jackpot.desc: The damage increases at the same rate as Jackpot, however, if the number exceeds 110, it will deal 1 damage. Mega-jackpot's color is green with green sparkles.

ultra_jackpot.desc: The damage increases at the same rate as Jackpot, however, if the number exceeds 120, it will deal 1 damage. Ultra-jackpot's color is turquoise with blue sparkles.

lottery.desc: The damage increases at the same rate as Jackpot, however, if the number exceeds 130 it will deal only 1 damage. Lottery's color is light-green with purple sparkles. At equal elevation, you can fire this with full power.

early_bird.desc: Early bird is one of the few weapons that seem normal but actually is not. The weapon shoots a shot that automatically explodes after a very short time. The time is short enough that even when shot at 100 power, the shot is unable to make it beyond the length of the firing circle. The shot will also explode if it hits an enemy before the timer expires, making this an excellent short range weapon.

early_worm.desc: Behaves exactly like Early Bird with an increased timer. Damage remains untouched and the shot still explodes prematurely on contact with terrain or enemy tanks.

recruiter.desc: A green flare is shot like normal. When it comes to a rest, blue shots will come in from both sides of the screen, hitting mostly in the place where the flare landed.

enroller.desc: Behaves just like Recruiter, except the projectiles are now green and 3 more shots are fired.

enlister.desc: Like Enroller, but changes the color to a darker green and adds 3 more shots for a grand total of 20.

fury.desc: A shot is fired like normal. When it hits the ground, it rises straight up into the air and proceeds to rain down a barrage of tiny fireball-like projectiles. The projectiles do not leave fire and explode upon impact.

rage.desc: Similar to Fury, but adds an extra "fury projectile" that's blue, rises higher and also drops larger pellets below where it rises. However, it doesn't last as long as the other projectile does.

relocator.desc: A normal shot is fired. Upon landing, a red circle is outlined. This weapon will teleport anything in its radius, but it will only deal damage to enemy tanks

displacement_bomb.desc: Similarly to Relocator, the weapon will teleport anything in it's radius, with the same damage, only the AoE is doubled and the color changes to blue.

imploder.desc: The user starts to charge itself, building up tremendous energy until it creates a massive explosion dealing damage to themselves and the other players in the vicinity. The ally and self-damage is around half of the user's health before firing. Enemies, however, receive 200 damage no matter how much self-damage the user gets.

ultimate_imploder.desc: The Ultimate Imploder doesn't change the damage values, but it creates a bigger explosion for bigger destruction.

stone.desc: Stone acts similar to bounsplode, but does not damage terrain while bouncing and deals less and less damage as it bounces. After the last bounce, the stone explodes upon hitting the ground, leaving a small hole and doing damage. A great starting weapon against enemies in small holes or on flat land.

boulder.desc: Boulder is the same as stone, but adds in more bounces. The boulder is also bigger than stone.

fireball.desc: Not exactly a fireball that is seen in comics or movies. It is instead a large molten boulder that is burning with flames. Same as stone, it bounces and deals damage, except it leaves behind fire particles every time it does so, dealing additional damage. It has many more bounces as well, allowing larger damage outputs. An excellent weapon for enemies in small holes or on flat land at close range.

cat.desc: A simple first tier weapon, a large cat will fly and explode on the ground upon impact, dealing a solid 40 damage and leaving a crater as big as a grenade would create.

kittens.desc: You know what's more adorable that a cat? kittens. Do you know what's better? 10 kittens. The 2nd Tier of cats will make you shoot 10 small kittens in a

super_cat.desc: Is it a bird? Is it a plane? No, its Super Cat! The third tier that require 3,100xp resembles the first tier mentioned earlier, but more powerful. It deals 55 damage and has a bigger blast radius. True to its name, it is also seen wearing a red cape.

cats_and_dogs.desc: Unlike the previous variants, Cats and Dogs shoots a flare, rather than a direct impact shot.  If you're wondering why the flare is a dog bone, that is because there are dogs in this tier. Soon after the flare lands, it literally starts raining cats and dogs. The damage and blast radius varies depending on the size of the animal that hit the enemy.

ghost_bomb.desc: Ghost Bomb shoots a single projectile that has a fairly large explosion radius.
