Although not as powerful as Nuke, Ghost Bomb can serve as an alternative for players who are yet to unlock Nuke. Ghost Bomb also does not damage terrain, making it useful for hitting multiple enemies while keeping your aim on them.

ghostlets.desc: Ghostlets shoots 5 smaller ghosts that have both decreased damage and splash radius. Ghostlets can be used to hit a large area on the map, or can be concentrated against a single target for increased total damage.

flasher.desc: A single projectile is shot. Upon landing, 14 bright explosions happen rapidly one after the other, starting from the shot's impact point. The explosions increase in size as they manifest, letting some misses do minor damage.

strobie.desc: Strobie is the same as Flasher, but has more explosions, and results in a larger radius. Strobie adds 4 blasts, resulting in 18 total explosions.

rave.desc: Rave is the same as the its younger brothers, but has even more explosions, and thus, an even larger radius. Rave adds 4 more explosions, making it a total of 22 explosions.

sprouter.desc: Shoots a shot like normal. When the shot hits the terrain, 4 equally spaced projectiles will fly out from both sides and explode when coming back down to the ground. The projectiles are subject to wind, so be mindful. This weapon works best on flat land or small hills.

blossom.desc: Works like sprouter, but once the projectiles reach the top of their arc, a second wave of projectiles emerge from the first wave, allowing more damage output and further travel in wind, if that is what the player wants to do.

square.desc: Fires a "square" that airbursts into four seperate fragments, each fragment dealing 30 damage. Fragments will fly in the direction the piece is facing when the shot bursts.

hexagon.desc: Same as the above, but with a 6 piece hexagon.

octagon.desc: Same as the above, but with an 8 piece octagon. Assuming Octagon bursts above a flat surface, it will deal damage in a large area.

kooky_cluster.desc: Same as wacky cluster, but adds a

crazy_cluster.desc: Same as kooky cluster, but adds a

satellite.desc: A flare based weapon that creates a vertical beam and damages any player in radius by 50 damage. It has approximately the same radius as Big Shot.

ufo.desc: Almost identical with the tier 1, except one major difference, the radius is greatly increased while still dealing 50 damage. It has approximately the same radius as Massive Shot.

palm.desc: A shot is shot like normal. When it hits the ground, it rises straight up in the air, influenced by wind. After rising a bit, the projectile spits into 5, one going straight down and 2 going off towards the sides on both sides, giving it the appearance of a palm tree.

double_palm.desc: Shoots the shot like normal. Upon impact, the projectile splits into two that jump off to the side and then splits like normal.

triple_palm.desc: Similar to double palm, but adds in the middle "tree", resulting in something that looks just like the weapon icon.

shockshell.desc: Perhaps the most obvious wordplay, ShockShell is a great weapon. It is almost a guaranteed 35 damage, depending on who is in the way. When shot at a high power it can do an arcing short distance jump, during which it can be influenced by x2, targets etc. and can even jump above players. As soon as it hits the ground it goes on to infinity and beyond until it either hits a tank. An enemy tank stops it and takes damage, while friendly tanks do not, even though it also stops the shell. If there are no alive tanks in the way, the shell simply glides out of the map. Because of its infinite lifespan on the ground, it will pass through any bumpers in the way as well. Firing at 90 degrees doesn't lead you anywhere, as well as firing too steeply into the ground. The weapon will only deal damage to you if it hits an enemy standing right next to you, so even firing with 0 power is safe. If an enemy is at 35 health or lower, or hiding behind a bumper, shock him with this shell.

shockshell_trio.desc: For those who think one shell is not enough, this weapon shoots 3 shells instead of 1! They have reduced damage, but deal more total damage. Since there are 3 shells, you can destroy an enemy with one shell and have the rest hit more enemies.

fountain.desc: This weapon will create a simple, one-level high fountain on demand. As pretty as it looks, it's unadvisable for tanks to get near it.

waterworks.desc: You say that one-level is not enough? Well then here, have a double. This upgraded fountain is a true masterpiece, and will shoot a small and a big fountain stimultaneously! For a slighty decrease in power, but that's a small price to pay for such a show!

sprinkler.desc: It's summer again, and these nasty tanks keep destroying your lawn? Never fear! Simply set up this sprinkler and it will take good care of anyone in its close vicinity. Upon landing on the ground, Sprinkler will spray water in a 180 degrees spread in a preset pattern. Sprinkler goes around 3 times with the water spraying in the same spots every time. Setting it up on a hill can maximize effectiveness, spreading water over a large area. Let those tanks know where their place is!

flattener.desc: Fires a somewhat large bullet that when landing, flattens the terrain in the same radius as

wall.desc: Creates a wall around four times the height of the players tank. The area of effect for damage is any enemy directly hit and a small area around the created wall. Its AI is the same as

fortress.desc: Fortress creates 2 mini walls off to the sides of the shot's landing spot with the

funnel.desc: When shot, Funnel creates something that exactly resembles its weapon icon by raising terrain on triangles that cutoff at their peaks.

chicken_fling.desc: Fires three drumsticks that have various degrees of spread. The spread is random each shot, so there is no absolute good way of shooting this weapon except for blasting close range opponents that are within a direct line of sight at 100 power. Damage is heavily distance based, so hitting some long range hits is better than hitting all shots at close range.

chicken_hurl.desc: More chicken! Works just like chicken-fling, but adds in an extra drumstick. Unlike most weapons, damage is unaffected!

chicken_launch.desc: The most chicken kChamp is willing to give us. Fires five drumsticks at the same exact damage as before.

mad_birds.desc: Unleashes a red bird. It deals a decent 40 damage to enemies with a small damage radius, letting near misses do damage as well. It should be noted that all birds only do damage on the first hit with the ground. Afterwards, the bird will bounce and hit the ground a second time. This is only for show, and does nothing.

furious_birds.desc: The Furious Birds deepen the Angry Birds reference by adding its second type of bird: the blue bird. First the weapon fires a red bird that has its damage reduced to 30, following up with the blue bird that, just like in Angry Birds, splits into 3. One projectile goes directly where you shoot and the other 2 split equally to the left and right. They each deal 15 damage. The best way to fire this weapon is at a close distance and about 45 degrees. This way all projectiles hit and deal a significant amount of damage.

livid_birds.desc: The Livid Birds add the most destructive bird of the game they imitate: the yellow bird. The weapon fires a red bird that had its damage reduced to 20, then the blue bird, that now only does 10 per projectile and then the yellow bird that deals 40 damage. As a being of pure hate the yellow bird accelerates shortly before impact, which may lead to it missing where your other birds hit. Because of this and for the same reason as the Furious Birds a short range attack with about 45 degrees is the best way to go about things, since this is the best way to hit all the birds, which is necessary, because the guaranteed hits are only the red and 1 blue bird otherwise, which would only deal 30 damage.

pepper.desc: This weapon sends 10 peppers into your enemy, dealing 3 damage each and leaving a small hole on its impact, making it one of the smallest projectiles that can destroy terrain.

salt_and_pepper.desc: The 2nd tier adds a second burst of projectiles (assumed to be salt) that do 2 damage each and has noticeably more spread than the pepper wave.

paprika.desc: Paprika reverts back to firing only one burst of projectiles like Pepper, but deals more damage, even surpassing the double burst of Salt and Pepper.

cayenne.desc: The spice projectiles are now so spicy that enemies will feel the burn quite literally. Unlike other weapons in the Pepper family, the projectiles from this weapon act similar to Flame, doing damage over time and does not damage the terrain.

needler.desc: The Needler sprays 15 pink needles all over the place and after some delay explode one after another. They need to be directly next to or on an enemy to do damage. The weapon damage scales along with distance; its minimum damage is low enough to chunk tank health at close range, while its maximum damage and spread is high enough to make it a viable mid-range weapon.

dual_needler.desc: Going akimbo for more projectiles is always the way to go. Dual Needler adds 5 projectiles, increasing the minimum damage from 60 to 80 and the maximum damage from 150 to 200. The mid range sweetspot mentioned before makes this weapon a devastating choice.

beacon.desc: Beacon acts as a flare when shot. When it rests, it explodes, dealing damage. A bunch of smaller projectiles fly outwards, bounded by two invisible barriers that apply only to the beacon's projectiles, dealing more damage as they come down. As the two barriers are both very close to where the initial shot landed, it is highly recommended to land a direct hit with beacon. Note, should the tiny projectiles go through a portal, the barriers will not apply and the projectiles will fly away like normal.

beaconator.desc: Acts just like beacon, except a larger projectile is launched straight up in the air with the smaller projectiles and has a slightly bigger explosion radius.

kernels.desc: Shoots a bunch of popcorn kernels that act like flares. When they come to a rest, they will damage tanks that are on top of the kernels. Damage is distance based.

popcorn.desc: Similar to kernels, but the kernels actually pops into popcorn! The popcorn will pop and fly upwards a little before coming back down and damaging enemies. The AOE of this weapon varies, but as long as the kernels land somewhere near your target, you have a good chance of hitting them.

burnt_popcorn.desc: Works just like popcorn, but has the popcorn pop while on fire. Does slightly more damage than popcorn.

chopper.desc: Fires a helicopter into the air, and targets the nearest tank relative to itself. It fires at it while moving slowly through the air.

apache.desc: Fires a larger helicopter that fires higher damage shots and causes a larger explosion.

flintlock.desc: A ground piercing spray of bullets, if used right it can deal enormous damage.

blunderbuss.desc: Similar to flintlock with more bullets fired

skullshot.desc: Skullshot shoots a skull and crossbones projectile that splits in the air, splitting into a skull and 2 bones. There is a bit of spread when used long range.

skeleton.desc: Splits into a skull and 6 bones, allowing more damage output.

pinpoint.desc: Most of the flare types weapons you've seen deal area damage, this is the complete opposite of them, where the flare ball stops is where the damage will take place specifically. 15 "pins" will rain down from the sky in a almost straight line. Each pin deals 4 damage and does not break the terrain. Be careful of the wind because it can nudge them away from where they should land.

needles.desc: An upgrade of pinpoint, it has a slightly larger AOE on the "needles" compared to the pins. It also has more projectiles.

pins_and_needles.desc: The final upgrade of this weapon series, it packs a mighty punch firing a large amount of both pins and needles. They are identical in stats however, so the "pins and needles" skin is entirely vanity.

fat_stacks.desc: Fat stacks shoots several dollar bills in a straight line towards the angle you are aimed at. After a bit, depending on your power, the bills will drop straight down, damaging enemies. If the bills hit someone before this process, they will take damage. The dollar bills have to hit terrain in order to do damage to yourself, but can hit enemy tanks directly tanks.

dolla_bills.desc: Shoots more projectiles with a slightly smaller damage cap.

make_it_rain.desc: Shoots more projectiles than its previous tier with a slightly smaller damage cap.

god_rays.desc: Let the rays from heaven blow your enemies away into nonexistence with this heavenly weapon. With 36 projectiles coming from 3 different rays of light(12 per) all dealing 6 damage each, it is truly a sight to see. If you manage to land every single shot you end up with 216 damage.

deity.desc: If you think God Rays is a sight of pure beauty, wait until someone fires Deity.  Instead of 3 rays, Deity has 5 rays, almost covering half of the screen.  Coming with the 5 rays is 60 projectiles(5 Damage Each).  If you somehow land all of these shots it can deal 300 damage!

hidden_blade.desc: For starters you will use something simple. This may be small, but it's more than enough to do damage in a decent area without leaving a trace. Use it wisely.

secret_blade.desc: Now that you have some training, you're ready to step up. Use this to further expand on your assassination skills. And remember, not a trace.

concealed_blade.desc: You are ready. Take this concealed blade and wield it wisely. no foe shall now stand in your path, and nobody will ever know what happened to those who do. Take good care, and do not let this power overcome you.

portal_gun.desc: This weapon creates portal 2 portals (Right above where it lands and another one higher than the first one) then spawns a Companion Cube in between to travel in and out of the two portal creating its speed. After some time, the two portals dissolve and the accelerating cube smashes into the ground, dealing damage.

ashpd.desc: Much like the first tier, it sends two portals for a cube to traverse in, except the gap between the two portals is much bigger, giving the cube more time to speed up and deal more damage.

drone.desc: Shoots a drone like the ones that spawn naturally. Once it reaches the peak of its arc, it selects a player at random, firing shots at them that ignore terrain and obstacles. The drone will only hit one enemy, even if two enemies or an enemy and a teammate are stacked.

heavy_drone.desc: A stronger drone that packs a slightly harder punch.

volcano.desc: This weapon is not exactly what you might think it is. In fact, it's not. Volcano basically acts like a bulger, dealing the same 20 damage, but adds in fire particles that fly out from the top, dealing a little extra damage.

eruption.desc: The same as volcano, but adds in more fire.

throwing_star.desc: This weapon is exactly what it sounds like, although it does not do what you might think. Like what one might think, a throwing star is shot like a normal shot. Upon landing however, it does not deal damage. In fact, it rises in the air a bit, then shoots out 4 stars on both sides in a manner somewhat like carpet bomb, damaging enemies. Note: a miss with this weapon is REQUIRED in order to do damage, as the initial shot does not do any damage.

multi_star.desc: Same as throwing star, but shoots 5 stars on both sides, allowing more hits and potentially more damage output.

ninja.desc: Same as throwing star, but shoots 6 stars on both sides.

skeet.desc: For anyone who knows what skeet shooting is, they can definitely guess what this weapon does. Three clay pigeons are shot with a slight deviation in angle and power. After a skeet reaches the highest point of their arc, a bullet is shot at it in a straight line. It can be obstructed by land, but if it hits the pigeons it will break each of them into 7 shards that damages your enemy. Because the shards spread in a shotgun fashion, it is best to break the pigeons as close to the enemy as possible. It is recommended to use this weapon in a open area, as the terrain can block the bullets and cause the pigeons to not break. Damage is distance based.

olympic_skeet.desc: Similar to skeet, but shoots a red pigeon, a white pigeon, and a blue pigeon, each breaking into 9 shards after being shot. It tends to be better than skeet, although statistically identical.

tangent_fire.desc: A single shot is fired. Projectiles are rapidly spawned from it, tangent to the shot's arc. It is recommended to use this weapon with high angles, causing the spawned projectiles to land very close to the initial shot's landing spot.

tangent_attack.desc: Same as tangent fire, but spawns in "tangent line" projectiles at a faster rate.

tangent_assault.desc: This variant has the fastest spawning rate of all, allowing noticeably more damage to be done when shot at high angles.

summoner.desc: Summoner shoots a shot that seems to vanish into the ground. A moment later, small hovering projectiles will appear above the initial shot's landing spot, influenced by wind. The projectiles proceed to slam themselves into the ground, damaging anyone underneath. Because the projectiles have a bit of spread when spawning, it is advised to use this weapon against enemies on flat ground. Should the projectiles spawn inside a circle bumper, the results may or may not be good.

mage.desc: Mage reduces the amount of damage done, but adds in noticeably more projectiles, increasing total damage done.

travelers.desc: Travelers is an RNG weapon that is heavily reliant upon luck. Upon impact 5 yellow arrows split and travel in seemingly random directions. The arrows deal constant damage as long as they are on top of an enemy tank. Damage is distance based.

scavengers.desc: Scavengers is a more vicious version of travelers. After the 5 arrows split up and fly away, 5 more arrows appear, dealing even more damage. Those that are unfortunate enough to be at the edge of the map when hit by this weapon has a good chance of losing 100+ health.

jack_o_lantern.desc: Jack-o-lantern acts somewhat like a grenade and shrapnel at the same time. A glowing jack-o-lantern is shot and it will bounce around, leaving behind some fire at times. When it comes to a rest, it will explode, dealing damage. Seeds will also pop out, which deal additional damage.

jack_o_vomit.desc: Similar to jack-o-lantern, but barfs out a volley of seeds sometime before exploding. When it vomits its seeds, the pumpkin's horizontal velocity will be reduced.

wicked_witch.desc: Shoots a cackling witch that acts somewhat like a normal shot, but has an odd trajectory at times when shot. The witch does have a bit of AOE, meaning a slight miss can still hit. If the witch hits a bumper, there can be unexpected results, similar to the

witches_broom.desc: Along with the witch, two flying brooms are also shot. If all three projectiles hit, the total damage done will be more than its previous tier.

ghouls.desc: The complete Halloween set. Ghouls shoots the witch, the two brooms, and two ghosts. Significant damage can be dealt and because damage is not distance based, it may be better to use this weapon when you have a direct line of sight to your target at close range.

botherer.desc: Botherer will stop mid-air when it gets to ~43 PU away from an enemy tank, and  will proceed to rapidly spray 30 projectiles that deal 5 damage each. At very close range, it does 1 damage per projectile, otherwise it does 5 per projectile.

tormentor.desc: Tormentor stops at the same range as Botherer and will fire 40 projectiles in rapid succession that each deal 4 damage. At very close range, it does 1 damage per projectile, otherwise it does 4 per projectile.

punisher.desc: Punisher stops at the same range as Botherer and will rapidly fire 60 projectiles that each deal 3 damage. At very close range, it does 1 damage per projectile, otherwise it does 3 per projectile.

oddball.desc: Shoots a ball that poops out little green skulls, each dealing 10 damage. When it comes to a rest, it will explode, but its radius is that of a Snowball's. Deals 10 damage.

oddbomb.desc: The upgrade of our erratic friend, the Oddbomb! This version changes the skulls' color to orange, and having a bigger final explosion at the end of its life cycle. The final explosion does 40 damage.

permaroller.desc: A roller, but with a twist: It only does damage at the end of it's path (not when colliding with a tank), but does a lot more damage than a roller. From start to finish the permaroller should roll for 2 seconds

heavy_permaroller.desc: This Permaroller is slightly bigger in size and blast radius, rolls for about 1 second longer for a total roll time of 3 seconds, and does a bit more damage.

cropduster.desc: Throws a projectile resulting in a nauseous stench hitting your enemies.

noxiousduster.desc: Shoots an even worse smell with more damage and spread.

toxicduster.desc: Shoots the worst smell with more damage and spread.

small_potion.desc: Heals whoever is in the effect radius.

medium_potion.desc: Heals whoever is in the effect radius.

large_potion.desc: Heals whoever is in the effect radius.

huge_potion.desc: Heals whoever is in the effect radius.

health_aura.desc: Summons a healing circle around the user's tank, attaining to tank damage.

censorbar.desc: Shoots a censored bar, doing a random amount of damage in intervals of 0-9 per hit.

restrictedbar.desc: Shoots a restricted bar doing random intervals of damage from 1-11 per hit.

redactedbar.desc: Shoots a redacted bar doing random intervals of damage from 1-13 per hit.

kiss.desc: A simple kiss, sucking the life from your enemy.

french_kiss.desc: Increases the damage dealt and the healing slightly.

smooch.desc: Increases both the damage and the healing even further.

confuser.desc: Confuses all tanks in range, causing them to shoot a projectile onto themselves. Works on allies, enemies, and dead tanks.

super_confuser.desc: Same as the previous tier, but packs a heavier punch in a larger area. Even more confusing.

mega_confuser.desc: The most confusing of them all. Packs an even heavier punch, making it a great choice vs a stack.
